summary: Official notification from the Metropolitan Correctional Center warden to federal judges regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The letter states Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell from an apparent suicide, was transported to a hospital, and was pronounced dead. It notes pending autopsy and investigations by the FBI and DOJ Inspector General.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center around 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead at 7:37 a.m.

events.title: Initiation of FBI and DOJ OIG Investigations
events.description: Following Epstein's death, the FBI began actively investigating the incident, and the Attorney General requested the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General to also investigate.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at approximately 7:37 a.m. at a New York hospital.
He was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center around 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide.
The official cause of death was pending an autopsy at the time of the notification.
The FBI and the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General were both investigating the incident.
The notification was sent to Chief Judge Colleen McMahon and District Judge Richard M. Berman, who were presiding over the case United States v. Jeffrey Epstein (19-cr-00490-RMB).
